categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Technical Discussions (January 6-7, 2026)

content.text:
## Discord Plugin Issues and Fixes

A user (DigitalDiva) encountered persistent issues with the Discord plugin not detecting server IDs, usernames, or server ownership despite proper configuration. The error "No server ID found 10" was traced to version compatibility issues between ElizaOS 1.7.0 and plugin-discord 1.3.3. Odilitime identified the problem as a transition from `serverId` to `messageServerId` in the codebase and created a fix branch (odi-17) to address bootstrap actions/providers issues. A formal PR (#6333) was submitted to fix plugin-bootstrap and SQL minor actions/providers for serverId compatibility. The team recommended users experiencing similar issues either wait for the fix or temporarily use version 1.6.5.

## New Contributor Onboarding

A blockchain and AI engineer (aicodeflow.dev) joined the community expressing interest in contributing to ElizaOS, particularly around agent autonomy with constraints, onchain execution layers with guardrails, prediction markets/event-driven systems, and observability tooling. Odilitime welcomed them and suggested starting by reading the code and working on plugins from github.com/elizaos-plugins/. The lead developer also mentioned upcoming open sessions and recommended connecting with the team. The contributor was directed to explore the Spartan project (https://github.com/elizaos/spartan), which focuses on DeFi utilities and quantitative trading features.

## Database Migration Issues

A developer encountered destructive migration errors when running `elizaos start` a second time. The error indicated that columns would be dropped unless explicitly allowed. The solution provided was to either set `ELIZA_ALLOW_DESTRUCTIVE_MIGRATIONS=true` for local development or use the `elizaos dev` command for continuous monitoring during development. This is safe for local environments but requires careful review for production deployments.

## Token Migration and Contract Address Visibility

Community members raised concerns about the difficulty of finding official ElizaOS contract addresses (CA) across social media platforms. Users noted that the CA wasn't posted on official X accounts, making it hard for newcomers to verify legitimate tokens. Shaw acknowledged the feedback and committed to addressing this issue. There was discussion about whether to include CAs in Twitter bios or pinned tweets, with the team noting that most top projects don't follow this pattern but agreeing that the current flow doesn't work well. The team mentioned that the linktree is being refreshed to point to CoinGecko for easier token information access.

## Core Development Updates

The core development team discussed several technical improvements:

- **Cursor AI Integration**: Odilitime noted that using your own Claude API key in Cursor doesn't provide the Cursor-optimized version of Claude with enhanced output tricks.

- **Cloud Architecture**: Stan submitted an RFC (RFC-001) exploring hybrid architecture with persistent workers for ElizaOS Cloud, focusing on handling TOCTOU race conditions and runtime initialization optimizations. The document is available at https://hackmd.io/@0PzDTGXqRg6nOCDoEwaN-A/SyDNAAiVWe

- **Messaging API Refactoring**: Stan submitted PRs for unified messaging API implementation in both Telegram and Discord plugins, moving from deprecated `sendMessage` to `handleMessage` for better consistency.

- **Gateway Architecture**: Discussion around Discord bridge implementation, with Odilitime recommending review of the Jeju cloud branch (https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza-cloud-v2/tree/jeju/apps/discord-gateway) for Shaw's preferred implementation. The team discussed scaling considerations for event pumps, noting that voice connections will need higher priority/bandwidth than text.

- **Documentation**: Jin shared the team's HackMD workspace at https://hackmd.io/@elizaos/book for collaborative documentation.

## Community Integrations and Tools

- **X402 Protocol**: AlleyBoss announced an updated library for experimenting with x402 protocol integrated with ElizaOS: `npm i @alleyboss/micropay-solana-x402-paywall`

- **GitHub Agentic Workflows**: Jin shared GitHub's agentic workflows documentation (https://github.com/githubnext/agentics/blob/main/workflows/update-docs.md) as a reference for the community.

- **HackMD Partnership**: A representative from HackMD reached out expressing support for ElizaOS builders using their platform, with Jin connecting them for potential collaboration.

- **Zoey Framework**: Odilitime mentioned that Neo rolled out a Rust-inspired ElizaOS alternative called Zoey (https://zoey.xyz/), described as a privacy-first, local-first AI agent framework.

## Miscellaneous Updates

- The team discussed incorrect information about EigenLayer appearing in LLM outputs, traced back to inaccurate facts on Eigen's website that are now being propagated by AI models.

- NVIDIA announced the Rubin platform with six new chips, making Blackwell "old news" according to community discussions.

- ElizaOS was featured in a video compilation about AI projects, shared by the community.

- There was discussion about DegenAI development and its relationship to ElizaOS, with some community members suggesting consolidation of utility into the main ElizaOS project.

**Issue #6332: Excessive Memory Consumption in Turbo Build**

A performance issue has been reported where Turbo build is consuming excessive memory, reaching 21GB or more. This issue was reported by madjin and requires investigation to optimize memory usage during the build process.

**Issue #6331: Model Not Found Error with Agent ID**

A bug has been identified where using an agent ID with API endpoints results in a "Model not found" error. This issue was reported by madjin and affects API endpoint functionality when attempting to reference models by agent ID.

During the period from January 6th to January 7th, 2026, the elizaos/eliza repository showed minimal activity. There were no new pull requests created or merged during this timeframe. However, 2 new issues were opened, and 2 contributors were active in the repository during this period.
sources: From 2026-01-06 to 2026-01-07, elizaos/eliza had 0 new PRs (0 merged), 2 new issues, and 2 active contributors.
